harshit.metropolisViewer

Class MetropolisTableModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • harshit.metropolisViewer.MetropolisTableModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.table.TableModel

    public class MetropolisTableModel
extends javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
    Extents the AbstractTableModel to create a model for Metropolis table with 3 columns (Metropolis, Continents, Population). Required connection to a database. Support adding a new row, and searching for an existing row
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MetropolisTableModel()
      Establishes the connection to the account, set the database to be used, initializes the ResultSet variable belonging to this class.

      • getColumnName

        public java.lang.String getColumnName(int column)
        Returns a name for the column based on the column number. 0 = Metropolis, 1 = Continents, 2 = Population
        Specified by:
        getColumnName in interface javax.swing.table.TableModel
        Overrides:
        getColumnName in class javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
        Parameters:

      • search

        public void search(java.lang.String metropolis,
          java.lang.String continent,
          java.lang.String population,
          boolean ExactStrings,
          int popType)
        Searches the database based on the given parameters
        Parameters:
        metropolis - : This value is used to search the metropolis field of the database
        continent - : This value is used to search the continent field of the database
        population - : This value is used to search the population field of the database. Should contain valid integer values.
        ExactStrings - : True = Only Accept Exact Match Strings for metropolis, continent and population fields. False = Accept Partial Strings.
        popType - : 1 would invoke "Greater Than" comparison against the population, 2 would invoke "Less Than" comparison against population, others would be don't care.

      • addRow

        public void addRow(java.lang.String str1,
          java.lang.String str2,
          java.lang.String str3)
        Adds a row with the given values and publishes the added row to the table
        Parameters:
        str1 - : Metropolis column data
        str2 - : Continents column data
        str3 - : Is stored as a BigInteger in the "Population column"
